root.comment: The sequence of car operation: The IGNITION key closes the SWITCH, allowing the BATTERY to send CURRENT to the ENGINE. This power spins the GEARS, which rotate the SHAFT, finally moving the TIRES.

layer-engine.name: ENGINE
layer-engine.comment: The 4-stroke cycle: Air enters the INTAKE, passes the VALVE into the CYLINDER. The RINGS seal the piston, allowing the STROKE (combustion) to generate power before gases leave via EXHAUST.

layer-physics.name: PHYSICS
layer-physics.comment: The spark plug physics: High VOLTAGE jumps the spark plug GAP, creating PLASMA and an electric ARC. This triggers fuel to COMBUST, releasing THERMAL energy which causes the gases to EXPAND.

layer-transmission.name: TRANSMISSION
layer-transmission.comment: Transferring power: The CLUTCH engages the engine to provide TORQUE. Transmission FLUID keeps the gears cool as they power the DRIVE shaft.

layer-traction.name: TRACTION
layer-traction.comment: Where the rubber meets the road: The tire RUBBER has TREAD to create FRICTION. This provides GRIP, provided the air PRESSURE is correct.

layer-ignition.name: IGNITION
layer-ignition.comment: The spark source: The ignition COIL sends power to the spark PLUG. The spark jumps the GAP in an electric ARC.

layer-electrical.name: ELECTRICAL
layer-electrical.comment: Battery internals: LEAD plates submerged in sulfuric ACID form a galvanic CELL to store energy.

layer-valvetrain.name: VALVETRAIN
layer-valvetrain.comment: Precision timing: The CAM shaft has a LOBE that provides LIFT to open the valve before it returns to its SEAT.

layer-emissions.name: EMISSIONS
layer-emissions.comment: Cleaning the air: Exhaust travels through the tail PIPE and MUFFLER to regulate gas FLOW and noise.

layer-combustion-chem.name: COMBUSTION CHEMISTRY
layer-combustion-chem.comment: Molecular reaction: FUEL is mixed with air; if there is too much air, the mixture is LEAN. Heat breaks the ATOM bonds.

layer-thermodynamics.name: THERMODYNAMICS
layer-thermodynamics.comment: Energy conversion: HEAT from combustion is converted into mechanical WORK, though some is always a thermal LOSS.
